trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The Honkdra can hold its breath for 1 hours.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The Honkdra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the Honkdra has advantage on saving throws against being knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the Honkdra takes 40 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the Honkdra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The Honkdra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the Honkdra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Honkdra's attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Honkdra regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the Honkdra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Reflective Plumage
entries: The Honkdra can't be affected or detected by spells of 2nd level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the Honkdra starts its turn with 90 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the Honkdra goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the Honkdra attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the Honkdra attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the Honkdra goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Honkdra fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Honkdra makes as many Engulfing Bite or Swallow attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Engulfing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) Piercing damage. In addition, any Medium or smaller creature must succeed on a 17 dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The Honkdra makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling with that head. If the attack hits, the target takes the attack damage as bludgeoning damage and is swallowed. While swallowed, a creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Honkdra and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the Honkdra's turns.
At any given time, the Honkdra's body is only capable of holding a number of swallowed creatures equal to half its number of heads, rounded down.

action.name: Regurgitation
entries: If the Honkdra takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Honkdra must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 15 feet of the Honkdra. If the Honkdra dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: HONK! (Costs 1 Action)
entries: The Honkdra lets out a thunderous honk in a 35-foot radius. Each creature in the area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) thunder damage on a failed save and is {@condition deafened} until the Honkdra's next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition deafened}.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Honkdra beats its wings. Each creature within 20 feet of the Honkdra must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The Honkdra can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Honkdra makes one Engulfing Bite attack or uses its Swallow.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The Honkdra can hold its breath for 2 hours.

Whenever the Honkdra takes 40 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the Honkdra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The Honkdra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

The Lords of the Honk
Masters of Honkdom
Bane of Peace

{@note {@b Disclaimer:} No groups of five geese were not fused together and altered into a huge monstrosity using powerful magics as part of the process for making these statblocks come into existence. Peace is always be an option, provided that you can speak goose and have the ability to cast tenth-level spells.}

{@note This is unofficial Fan Content permitted under the Fan Content Policy. Not approved/endorsed by Wizards. Portions of the materials used are property of Wizards of the Coast. Â©Wizards of the Coast LLC.}

entries.name: The Story Behind This
entries: This content started a few years back, when MZ4250 was not quote so well-known in the D&D community for his creations and had a much smaller base of patrons. He, being a human being and totally not a beholder, decided to ask his patrons to suggest something silly for him to make. The end result of that contest was a Goliath Barbarian wielding a halfling barbarian wielding a battleaxe. (the idea we had actually submitted)

cue a moment several years later, during the (European) evening chatter on his discord server... We asked him what was the funniest model he'd made. He mentioned that very model, which reminded us of the contest.
We stated the following:
you should do another fun model contest someday
and he replied with the following:
hmm
those WERE fun
yeah screw it lets make one now. Folks will have to vote on which stupid idea and what not.

A few minutes later and the contest was up. After something like seventy or so different ideas were voted on in the span of two rounds of polls, it as clear that the winner of the contest was the {@b Gooose Hydra}.

Of course, the Wizards of the Coast haven't actually made any statblocks for this particular breed of hydra (clearly a mistake on their part), so others had to step in to fix that. We discussed it for a while, had some fun and otherwise played around a bit before we got around to making the statblocks found here.

entries.name: About this content
entries: While not the first content we have created, it is the first we have done any attempt at publishing. We mostly made it out of curiosity and boredom, as well as finding the idea of making a really-high CR version of something so terrifying a worthy challenge.
We do hope you find some way to hurt entertain your players with this and (hopefully) not have too many TPKs in the process.
Cover Art: MZ4250

entries.name: Credits
entries: Making this remotely balanced (if anything on CR30 can ever be considered balanced) would not have been possible without assistance from others. We utilized a number of statblocks in Wizards of the Coast books, as well as having assistance from actual people (the horror). We can't mention them all (particularly without having permission from them), but suffice to say we had a variety of influences.
However, most of those who did assist us can be found on the following discord servers, in no particular order:

items: All images of the Honkdra (or Goose hydra) were made by MZ4250
{@link This PDF was made using GMbinder|https://gmbinder.com/}

entries.name: Disclaimer
entries: While we have not playtested these statblocks, they've been acquired by quite a lot of people since their initial release and the only comment so far relates to it having extraneous advantage against certain conditions it was already immune to. That has since been fixed. If you should discover something else that needs fixing, feel free to notify us and we will fix it.
